case_vignette: A 4-year-old boy presents to the opthalmologist for a down- and inward dislocation of the lens in his left eye. On physical exam, the boy has a marfanoid habitus and mental retardation. Biochemical tests were performed to locate the exact defect in this boy. It was found that there was a significant reduction of the conversion of 5,10-methyltetrahydrofolate to 5-methyltetrahydrofolate.
question: Which  is the diagnosis?
